roleset.name: to present, exhibit
roleset.note: DISPLAY-V NOTES: Member of VNcls reflexive_appearance-48.1.2. Updated by Julia, 12/2010. (from display.01-v)
DISPLAY-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to 'display.01-v'. Vn class reflexive_appearance-48.1.2. No Fn classes. Framed by Katie. (from display.01-n)

role.descr: displayed to whom? Seer of thing displayed

example.name: all arguments
example.text: She-1 had gone so far as [*-1] to display the questions on an overhead projector and underline the answers .

example.name: transitive
example.text: [The prime minister , whose hair is thinning and gray and whose face has a perpetual pallor ,]-1 nonetheless continues [*-1]to display an energy , a precision of thought and a willingness to say publicly what most other Asian leaders dare say only privately .
example.arg: an energy , a precision of thought and a willingness to say publicly what most other Asian leaders dare say only privately

example.name: Arg2 as a subject
example.text: One color photo displays a rainbow of dress shirts tied in a knot ; another picture shows neckties with bold designs .
example.arg: a rainbow of dress shirts tied in a knot

example.name: reflexive
example.text: His moral character displayed itself in the sincerity of his friendships, his love of justice and of truth .
example.arg: in the sincerity of his friendships, his love of justice and of truth

example.name: args 1 and 2
example.text: Several months ago , it also added black health and beauty aids displays to many stores
